I think that David Cameron was wrong to appoint someone to the heart of the government, to the heart of Downing Street, who had actually been editor of a newspaper at a time when criminal activity was going on, Ms Harriet Harman said. While acknowledging that Mr Andy Coulson had denied any involvement in phone hacking, she added the issue risked further eroding public confidence in politics. Mr David Cameron said he was "very sorry" Mr Andy Coulson felt "compelled" to go after months of intense pressure, insisting he was being punished for the same offence twice . Mr Andy Coulson resigned as editor of the News of the World in 2007 after the paper's former royal editor, Clive Goodman , and private investigator Glenn Mulcaire were jailed for phone hacking.
